Early life and education

Leonard Susskind was born in a Jewish family from the South Bronx section of the city of New York. She now lives in Palo Alto, California. At the age of 16, he started working as a plumber. Later, he joined the B.S graduate as an engineer student in New York City College. In 1965 he went to study at Cornell University under his Peter A. Carruthers for his Ph.d. Carrier

Schmidt teaches a series of study courses to continue Stanford about modern physics in the form of theoretical minimalism.
